title: Mount Bergin
text: Mount Bergin () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, 700 m, standing 4 nautical miles (7 km) west of <a href="Mount%20Maslen">Mount Maslen</a> in the <a href="Raggatt%20Mountains">Raggatt Mountains</a>, <a href="Enderby%20Land">Enderby Land</a>. It was plotted from air photos taken from ANARE (<a href="Australian%20National%20Antarctic%20Research%20Expeditions">Australian National Antarctic Research Expeditions</a>) aircraft in 1956. It was named by <a href="Antarctic%20Names%20Committee%20of%20Australia">Antarctic Names Committee of Australia</a> (ANCA) for <a href="R.D.%20Bergin">R.D. Bergin</a>, radio officer at Mawson station in 1956.
